page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Land features. The land mass is two plateaux with escarpments which give extensive views over the Vale of Belvoir and towards Lincoln. These are cut by the Canal and the Old Beck. The Grantham to Nottingham Canal, no longer navigable,follows an East/West direction and is fed from Denton Reservoir. The Viking Way is a famous, long distance footpath for walkers and crosses from south to north along the old Green Lane via Brewer's Grave towards Stenwith. The old mineral (ironstone) railway line can still be traced north to northeast from map ref. 84,36 to 86,34. Electricity pylons roughly follow the line of the canal from east to west. No villages or towns on our block. The farm land is red,rich and fertile.
